channel.title: Ind.ie News and Labs
channel.description: The latest news and updates from the Ind.ie blog and Ind.ie labs blog

item.title: Listen to Aral on the Boss Level Podcast
item.description: It"s one of Aral"s best interviews to date, where he explains how we must change mainstream technology.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Overhauling Better"s CSS
item.description:
Using ems, reducing repetition, and improving SVG icons."

Read the full post on the Ind.ie forum.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Your Mac, now Better.
item.description:
Today we're releasing

Better for Mac alongside Better for iPhone and iPad

item.title: A note about client-side-only JavaScript in Set templates
item.description:
Separating client-side and server-side functionality."

item.title: Update to GitLab Admin
item.description:
Useful if you’re working with the GitLab API and need quick access to group, project, and milestone IDs."

item.title: Swift libraries
item.description:
All our Swift libraries now support Swift 2.2.1, Swift 2.3, and Swift 3."

item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: Introducing Better
item.description:
Today we're releasing a new app. It's called

Better and it's a content blocker for iPhone and iPad.

item.description:

item.title: New Handle (v2.0.7) and Delay (v1.0.7) Swift micro-library releases

item.title: Set 2.0 release
item.description:
I just released version 2.0 of Set, my unobtrusive JavaScript template engine for Node.js and browsers."

item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: October Update
item.description:
European Parliament video, Ind.ie's entry in the Knight News Challenge, and recurring donations."

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Internet As A Commons at the European Parliament
item.description:
Tomorrow, Aral is speaking on a panel at the European Parliament in Brussel at a conference focused on "Internet as a Commons: Public Space in the Digital Age."

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Ind.ie joins the Web We Want Coalition
item.description:
We're really excited to be selected as one of the first one hundred new member organisations representing fifty countries across the globe.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: It's all about Heartbeat
item.description:
Today marks a change in direction for the Ind.ie Friday roundup as we shift our focus from the problem to the solution.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Oh, won't someone think of the children!
item.description:
Privacy in education, Google being Google, and how data farming is shaping our economy.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: One Billion Farmed
item.description:
Facebook's billion, content blocking, and a rapporteur that gives us hope…

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Silicon Valley Doublethink
item.description:
When is a hacker not a hacker? Morality, ethics, and privacy policies gone wild…

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: 3… 2… 1… Liftoff!
item.description:
This week Aral has been working non-stop on Heartbeat, and we've finally been able to share our hard work…

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: The Sticky, Pocked Underbelly Of The Web
item.description:
Swiss Cheese Internet vs The Database Of Ruin, The Right To Be Forgotten, and Diversity. Lots of variety in this week's roundup

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Windows To Your Soul
item.description:
This week's roundup brings you privacy, politics, tracking, Timelines, and a little thing called "corporate nullification."

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: The Social Web: A Glorious Dystopia
item.description:
Corporations want to get inside you, outside you, and all around you. This week's round up has cheeky corporations, postcapitalism, and what's a Panopticon again?

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Fight for your right to (Crypto) Party
item.description:
Jo writes about her first ever Crypto Party experience in London.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: jo@ind.ie (Jo Porter)

item.title: Tethered Beings
item.description:
The roundup is back! Aral and I are settling into our new office in the shed, and I've been itching to share links with you all week.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: Farewell Caspar
item.description:
We were sad to hear Caspar Bowden died this week. It's a huge blow to our community, and every citizen who has, and will still, benefit from his tenacious work for human rights.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie blog.
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)

item.title: July Update
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
There's no Friday roundup this week as Laura and I are busy packing.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: British Government Goes Bananas
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
The UK Conservative Government isn't even two months old, and everything is already going to hell in a handbasket. And our word of the week is "creepy"...

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: Big Data, Privacy and Ethics
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
I hope you've recovered from last week's mega roundup! This week's roundup brings you the politics of privacy, the sharing economy, and how a societal shift could save us all.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: The War on Encryption and Fight Trade Agreements
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
This week's Ind.ie roundup focuses on de-mystifying two areas relevant to our privacy and freedoms: encryption and trade deals.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: The Power Of An Informed Public
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
It's been two years since the Snowden revelations. This week's roundup looks at the progress we have, and haven't, made...

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: We Need An Internet Of People
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
This week's roundup takes its name from a fabulous article by Jenny Judge and Julia Powles, ‘Forget the internet of things – we need an internet of people.'

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: The Destiny Machine
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
It's back to business as usual for this week's roundup. We've got the latest in the world of Spyware 2.0, and some fun ways that people are challenging the system.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: Re:publica Special
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
For our re:publica roundup special, we're going to share some of our favourite talks from the week.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: Using System Headers In Swift
item.description:
CocoaPods to the rescue.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.
item.author: stefan@ind.ie (Stefan van den Oord)

item.title: Europe Needs A Digital Regulator
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
In this week's roundup we've got a new episode of Do Not Track and lots of follow-up on previous topics.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: Google Is The New Evil Empire
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
This week's roundup looks more closely at the EU vs Google antitrust battle, and how the world is wising up to Internet.org's misleading offerings.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: Handle
item.description:
A Swift micro-library for easily and expressively handling and posting notifications.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.
item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: Beware of Geeks Bearing Gifts
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
This week's roundup features law and regulation, those cheeky corporations, and how we might do things differently.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: Gracefully running node as an NSTask in Cocoa
item.description:
Tasks created by your app should be automatically terminated if your app crashes or when you kill your app by pressing the stop button in Xcode. They're not. This sample app shows one way around the problem by having your child task terminate itself if its parent dies.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.
item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: Delay
item.description:
A Swift micro-library for easily and expressively delaying execution of code.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.
item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: Europe fights back
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
This week's roundup brings you more on corporate surveillance, a couple of great videos with Edward Snowden, and Europe fighting back against Google and Facebook.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: Animating Cocoa Window Size When Using Auto Layout
item.description:
A simple example showing you how to cleanly change the window size when your views use auto layout.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.
item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: Change the whole system
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:
It wouldn't be a roundup without an excerpt from Bruce Schneier's book, Data and Goliath.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Blog.

item.title: NSSplitViewController Auto Layout Bug and Workaround
item.description:
Setting one of the two split view items in an NSSplitViewController as collapsed in Interface Builder can cause a runtime constraints error.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.
item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: When corporations control what you see...
item.author: laura@ind.ie (Laura Kalbag)
item.description:

item.title: SecRandomCopyBytes, or: Playing Unsafe with Swift
item.description:
There are many ways to generate random data on iOS and OS X, but I wanted to use this one because it is suitable for cryptographic purposes.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.

item.title: Installing NPM packages from GitLab repositories
item.description:
If you want to install an NPM package from a GitLab repository, use the git+https (or git+http) protocol, not git:// or https://.

Read the full post on the Ind.ie Labs blog.
item.author: aral@ind.ie (Aral Balkan)

item.title: Build-time optimisation with Xcode build scripts
item.description:
